citation.article-title: Halosimplex carlsbadense gen. nov., sp. nov., a unique halophilic archaeon, with three 16S rRNA genes, that grows only in defined medium with glycerol and acetate or pyruvate.

p.s: Description of Halosimplex carlsbadense sp. nov.
Halosimplex carlsbadense (carls.bad′.ense M.L. n carlsbad isolated near Carlsbad, New Mexico, USA)
Requires at least 0.5% (w/v) Mg2+, which can be supplied as either MgSO4 or MgCl2.
Optimum growth occurs in the presence of 1–2% (w/v) magnesium.
Sensitive to bacitracin (10 μg), sulfasoxazole (300 μg), novobiocin (30 μg), rifampin (5 μg), and monensin (100 μg ml–1).
Resistant to chloramphenicol, erythromycin, gentamycin, penicillin G, tetracycline, vancomycin, clindamycin, kanamycin, anisomycin, aphidocolin, neomycin, and valinomycin.
The type strain is 2–9-1 (ATCC BAA 75; JCM 11222).
Genes A and B are related to each other at 97.7% similarity.
Gene C is related to genes A and B at only 93.8% and 92.2%, respectively.
Genbank accession numbers Gene A AF320478; Gene B AF320479; Gene C AF320480.
